title: Perfect
comment: Always wanted a native app to check preferences when debugging application on my phone. This app was exactly what I wanted. Kudos to the developer! Had to reduce stars because doesn't work on Android 5
I really love this app ! Thanks dev 😊

title: Great app
comment: Sometimes files will be broken and this application cannot view them so if this is fixed, 5 stars.

title: Works like it should.
comment: On Lollipop 5.0 on a OnePlus One, and it works as it should. The UI is nicer than other preference apps too. Nice job developer!

title: Rocks
comment: Works awesome for me, thanks dev. I love this app and it's by far the best preferences editor on the market. The only thing i've thought of that could make it include support for sqlite3 but it's already an amazing app, and it's free ;-)

Thanks ;)
Sqlite is quite a different thing and couldn't be applied to SharedPreferences.
But I think you can easily find tools on the Google Play Store to edits such files with a dedicated interface.

title: HUGE potential, but misses LOTS of XML SharedPref entries.
comment: I spent a huge amount of time navigating the trenches of the root /data, /system folders, + individual APKs (user & system apps) manually through file explorers & XML editors; this app saves INFINITE time, but seriously misses 75%+ of the app's XML Pref files! Example: Manually editing XML Prefs for GS3's Messaging app via Root Explorer shows booleans for features hidden (show=false) from the regular in-app GUI menu like: Add a Subject line to SMS?; or to hide system WAP msg's to users? This app misses it!!

You can still edit file directly through the app as long as it is a XML file.
If the XML file isn't a system generated file (I mean created with the SharedPreferences framework) it won't be recognized by my app as a Preferences file.
Could you please give me more details about the file you're talking about (name, location, content structure)?

title: Great app, responsive developer.
comment: I like this app quite a bit, it's always fun having extra settings to fiddle with that they don't want you seeing normally, and that's exactly what I get here. All you need now is a backup/restore defaults function, and the option to create shortcuts on the home screen to directly edit a particular app's preferences without having to scan and load the entire list first. Otherwise, great app and thanks a bunch  :)  *Edit* That's great hearing about planned updates, this app is nearly perfect now, thanks!

Thanks a lot for this review.
The backup/restore function is on its way.
The Shortcut option is a neet idea indeed. It will be in the next release, but can't tell you when.
Very powerful tool

title: Nice
comment: Hey man nice app, beautiful and easy interface too, I'm going tip recommend your app for XDA news. Could you please make a dark theme for the app? My eyes hurt with all white background

title: Excellent
comment: This does exactly what you want. If you're here viewing this page in the first place, you know what you're looking for. This does it with a (unnecessarily) very beautiful, very easy interface. You can also add/remove preferences, that surprised me!  Note: As much as this has helped me - I would warn people to have data connection off when running this application just to be safe.

Thank you.
But do not worry. I do not require any network related permission and I'm not using any.
If you REALLY want to be sure, check the github page of the project, because this app is open source ;)

title: Exactly what i've been looking for
comment: I love it
